overview: Flat Rate VAT scheme - eligibility, thresholds, flat rates of VAT and joining or leaving the scheme
title: VAT Flat Rate Scheme

table.body:
Usually, how much VAT a business pays or claims back from HM Revenue & Customs (HMRC) is the difference between the VAT they charge customers and pay on their purchases.

With the Flat Rate Scheme:

+ you pay a [fixed rate](/vat-flat-rate-scheme/vat-flat-rates "Flat rates") of VAT over to HMRC
+ you keep the difference between what you charge your customers and pay over to HMRC
+ you can't reclaim the VAT on your purchases - except for certain [capital assets over £2,000](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/vat/start/schemes/flat-rate.htm#8 "Capital assets"){:rel="external"}

^ To join the scheme your VAT turnover must be less than £150,000 and you must apply to HMRC. ^

*[HMRC]: HM Revenue & Customs
*[VAT]: Value Added Tax
table.title: Overview

table.body:
##How to join 

You must be [eligible](/vat-flat-rate-scheme/eligibility "Eligibility") to join the scheme. To join, send HM Revenue & Customs (HMRC) form VAT600. The address is on the form. 

$D 
[Download form VAT600 FRS, Flat Rate Scheme application (PDF, 65KB)](http://customs.hmrc.gov.uk/channelsPortalWebApp/downloadFile?contentID=HMCE_CL_000057 "Download form VAT600 FRS Flat Rate Scheme application (PDF, 65KB)"){:rel="external"}  
[Download form VAT600 AA/FRS, Joint application for Flat Rate and Annual Accounting schemes (PDF, 85KB)](http://customs.hmrc.gov.uk/channelsPortalWebApp/downloadFile?contentID=HMCE_CL_000073 "Download form VAT 600 AA/FRS Joint application for Flat Rate and Annual Accounting Schemes (PDF, 85KB)"){:rel="external"}
$D

##How to leave

You can leave the scheme at anytime, but you must leave if you're no longer [eligible](/vat-flat-rate-scheme/eligibility "Eligibility") to be in it. 

To leave, write to HMRC and they will confirm when you can leave. 

^ You must wait 12 months before you can rejoin the scheme. ^

table.title: Join or leave the scheme

table.body:
You can join the Flat Rate Scheme if:

+ you're a VAT-registered business 
+ you expect your VAT taxable turnover to be less than £150,000 in the next 12 months 

^ [VAT taxable turnover](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/vat/start/register/when-to-register.htm#6 "Calculate your VAT taxable turnover"){:rel="external"} is the total of everything sold that isn't VAT exempt. ^ 

##Exceptions 

You can’t use the scheme if: 

+ you use the [VAT Cash Accounting Scheme](/vat-cash-accounting-scheme "VAT Cash Accounting Scheme")
+ you left the scheme in the last 12 months
+ you committed a VAT offence in the last 12 months - eg VAT evasion
+ you joined (or were eligible to join) a VAT group in the last 24 months
+ you registered for VAT as a business division in the last 24 months
+ your business is [closely associated with another business](http://customs.hmrc.gov.uk/channelsPortalWebApp/channelsPortalWebApp.portal?_nfpb=true&_pageLabel=pageLibrary_PublicNoticesAndInfoSheets&propertyType=document&columns=1&id=HMCE_CL_000345#P130_10988 "Closely associated businesses"){:rel="external"} 
+ you’ve joined a margin or capital goods VAT scheme

##Leaving the scheme 

You must leave the scheme if: 

+ you're no longer eligible to be in it 
+ on the anniversary of joining, your turnover in the last 12 months was more than £230,000 - or you expect it to be in the next 12 months 

*[HMRC]: HM Revenue & Customs
*[VAT]: Value Added Tax

The rate is a percentage of your business turnover. The actual rate depends on your business type. If the rate changes, you must apply the new rate from the date it changes.

^ In your first year as a VAT-registered business the rate is reduced by 1% until the day before your registration anniversary. ^
